H0.text: The equator is the region of the Earth that receives nearly vertical rays of solar energy year around, resulting in warm temperatures.

H1.text: Australia is the region of the Earth that receives nearly vertical rays of solar energy year around, resulting in warm temperatures.

H2.text: United States is a region of the Earth that receives nearly vertical rays of solar energy year around, which results in warm temperatures.

H3.text: North and South Poles are the regions of Earth that receive nearly vertical rays of solar energy year around, causing warm temperatures.

A4.text: noontime sunlight appears almost directly overhead (no more than about 23Â° from the zenith) every day, year-round.

A5.text: At the solstices, either pole is tilted towards or away from the sun, resulting in either summer or winter in both hemispheres.
